Enable TDD based sensitivity ratio for basal and glucose target modification Uses the last 24h TDD/7D TDD to calculate sensitivity ratio used for increasing or decreasing basal rate, and also adjust glucose target if these options are enabled, in the same way Autosens does. It is recommended to start with this option turned off Variant] Use TDD-based ISF DynamicISF Adjustment Factor % Adjustment factor for DynamicISF. Set more than 100% for more aggressive correction doses, and less than 100% for less aggressive corrections. ISF BG Scaling velocity % This controls how hard ISF will be changed with BG level change This controls how hard ISF will be changed with BG level change: 0% means no scaling at all, constant ISF value for every BG level; 100% - regular DynamicISF scaling high_temptarget_raises_sensitivity High temptarget raises sensitivity Raise sensitivity for temptargets >= 100 low_temptarget_lowers_sensitivity Low temptarget lowers sensitivity Lower sensitivity for temptargets < 100 OpenAPS SMB Dynamic ISF Boost Eating Now How frequently SMBs will be given in min Resistance lowers target When resistance is detected, lower the target glucose Sensitivity raises target When sensitivity is detected, raise the target glucose Plugin is disabled No glucose data available No autosens data available DYNISF Executing OpenAPS AMA Array of %1$d elements.
Actual value: OAPS State of the algorithm in 2017 Most recent algorithm for advanced users Most recent algorithm for advanced users with dynamic/automatic ISF Eating Now bolusing method Boost based accelerated bolusing Bolus snooze dia divisor
Run now Last run Input parameters Glucose status Current temp IOB data Profile Meal data Request Constraints Autosens data Script debug Use Autosens feature Max U/h a Temp Basal can be set to This value is called max basal in OpenAPS context Maximum basal IOB OpenAPS can deliver [U] This value is called Max IOB in OpenAPS context
This is maximal insulin in [U] APS can deliver at once. Default value: true
This is used to allow autosens to adjust BG targets, in addition to ISF and basals. Autosens adjust targets, too min_5m_carbimpact Default value: 3.0 (AMA) or 8.0 (SMB). This is a setting for default carb absorption impact per 5 minutes. The default is an expected 3mg/dl/5min. This affects how fast COB are decayed, and how much carb absorption is assumed in calculating future predicted BG, when BG is falling more than expected, or not rising as much as expected. Default value: 3 This is a key OpenAPS safety cap. What this does is limit your basals to be 3x (in this people) your biggest basal rate. You likely will not need to change this, but you should be aware that’s what is discussed about “3x max daily; 4x current” for safety caps. Default value: 4 This is the other half of the key OpenAPS safety caps, and the other half of “3x max daily; 4x current” of the safety caps. This means your basal, regardless of max basal set on your pump, cannot be any higher than this number times the current level of your basal. This is to prevent people from getting into dangerous territory by setting excessively high max basals before understanding how the algorithm works. Again, the default is 4x; most people will never need to adjust this and are instead more likely to need to adjust other settings if they feel like they are “running into” this safety cap. Default value: 2
Bolus snooze is enacted after you do a meal bolus, so the loop won’t counteract with low temps when you’ve just eaten. The example here and default is 2; so a 3 hour DIA means that bolus snooze will be gradually phased out over 1.5 hours (3DIA/2). Attention!
Normally you do not have to change these values below. Please CLICK HERE and READ the text and make sure you UNDERSTAND it before change any of these values. http://openaps.readthedocs.io/en/latest/docs/walkthrough/phase-3/beyond-low-glucose-suspend.html SMB/UAM max range extension Default value: 1 This is another key OpenAPS safety cap, and specifies by what factor you can exceed the regular 120 maxSMB/maxUAM minutes. Increase this experimental value slowly and with caution.
Always use short average delta instead of simple delta Useful when data from unfiltered sources like xDrip+ gets noisy. Max daily safety multiplier Current basal safety multiplier Maximum total IOB OpenAPS can't go over [U] This value is called Max IOB in OpenAPS context
OpenAPS will not add more insulin if current IOB is greater than this value fixed SMB delivery ratio variable SMB delivery ratio, lower end variable SMB delivery ratio, upper end variable SMB delivery ratio, mapped glucose range Default value: 0.5 This is another key OpenAPS safety cap, and specifies what share of the total insulin required can be delivered as SMB. This is to prevent people from getting into dangerous territory by setting SMB requests from the caregivers phone at the same time. Increase this experimental value slowly and with caution. Default value: 0.5 This is the lower end of a linearly increasing ratio rather than the fix value above. Default value: 0.5 This is the upper end of a linearly increasing ratio rather than the fix value above. Default value: 0. The linearly increasing SMB delivery ratio is mapped to the glucose range [target_bg, target_bg+bg_range].
At target_bg the SMB ratio is smb_delivery_ratio_min, at target_bg+bg_range it is smb_delivery_ratio_max
With 0 the linearly increasing SMB ratio is disabled and the fixed smb_delivery_ratio is used. Enable UAM Enable SMB Use Super Micro Boluses instead of temp basal for faster action Detection of Unannounced meals Enable SMB always Enable SMB always independently to boluses. Possible only with BG source with nice filtering of data like G5 Enable SMB after carbs Enable SMB for 6h after carbs, even with 0 COB. Possible only with BG source with nice filtering of data like G5 Enable SMB disregarding BG source (UNSAFE) Enable SMB even with noisy BG source (UNSAFE) Enable SMB with COB Enable SMB when there is COB active. Enable SMB with temp targets Enable SMB when there is temp target active (eating soon, exercise) Enable SMB with high temp targets Enable SMB when there is high temp target active (exercise, above 100 mg/dl or 5.5 mmol/l) Max minutes of basal to limit SMB to UAM SMB max minutes Max minutes of basal to limit SMB to for UAM Minimum Carbs Required For Suggestion Minimum grams of carbs to display a carbs suggestion alert. Carbs suggestions below this number will not trigger a notification. BG value below which insulin is suspended. Default value uses standard target model. User can set value between 60mg/dl (3.3mmol/l) and 100mg/dl(5.5mmol/l). Values below 65/3.6 result in use of default model BG level below which low glucose suspend occurs
Half basal exercise temp target BG (mg/dl) temp target to half the basal need when exercising
Increasing max basal value because setting is lower than your max basal in profile max basal multiplier max daily basal multiplier SMB disabled in preferences UAM disabled in preferences Autosens disabled in preferences Autosens disabled in DynISF
A52 risk enable Flag to disable Medtronic A52 error safety (should lead to more agressive bolusing)
Limiting IOB to %1$.1f U because of %2$s max value in preferences hard limit
Peak
smb_enable_carbs_suggestions_threshold
Run now A bolus was delivered within the last 3 minutes, skipping SMB Pump not initialized! LOOP Activate or deactivate the implementation triggering the loop. NO APS SELECTED OR PROVIDED RESULT Ignore 5m Ignore 15m Ignore 30m Carbs Suggestion New suggestion available Basal set correctly Last run APS Request After processed constraints Temp basal request time Temp basal execution time Temp basal set by pump SMB request time SMB execution time SMB set by pump Minimal request change [%] Open Loop will popup new change request only if change is bigger than this value in %. Default value is 20% Swap SMB and TBR commands order On some systems TBR can be very slow and delay or even prevent SMB from being submitted. This change makes SMB command go first, but can result in potential dangerous situation in case of TBR fail or pump connection break. Fallback to SMB. Not enough TDD data.

enableBoostPercentScale Boost_InsulinReq enableCircadianISF UAM Boost max IOB boost_variant Boost Insulin required % percentage of the algos determined insulin to give Boost variant Boost Max IOB allowed from accelerated bolusing Boost bolus in iu Boost scale value Percent scale factor for Boost Max percentage scale applied to Boost Percent scale factor Default value: 200
This is the maximum scale factor that Boost can use when increasing SMB sizes at lower glucose levels before returning to standrd settings at 180 or 10. Boost start time in hours Boost end time Boost bolus cap Boost bolus cap Default value: 0.1
This is the maximum bolus given by Boost components of the algorithm. Boost scale value Default value: 1.0
This is the numerical value by which you can multiply calculated boost value for boost. If this is set to 3 or more, Boost will be disabled. Default value: 0.1
This is the max IOB allowed for boost and accelerated bolusing to be allowed to take place. Once IOB is greater than this value, regular oref1 will be used. UAM Boost start time Default value: 7
This is the start time for the period in which boost is active (24 hours). UAM Boost start time UAM Boost end time Default value: 8
This is the end time for the period in which boost is active (24 hours). UAM Boost end time UAM Boost max IOB Enable Boost percentage scaling Enable boost scaling when glucose is between 108 mg/dl and 180 mg/dl. Starts at 150% of insulinRequired and stops at user entered Boost Percentage Required. Only activates when the difference between delta and short average delta is increasing. Enable Circadian ISF Enables the circadian ISF model enableBoost_with_high_temptarget Enable Boost with high temp targets Enable Boost when there is high temp target active (exercise, above 100 mg/dl or 5.5 mmol/l) Boost_settings Advanced settings Stepcount_settings Stepcount Settings Activity_settings Activity Settings The following preferences adjust the settings for stepcount related variability. The following stepcount settings allow control over when activity is recognised, and how long adjustments are made to account for it. You will probably need to make changes from the defaults.
Steps below which user is considered inactive Default value: 500
This is the number of steps in an hour below which a user is considered inactive, and a profile percentage increase will be enacted. Inactivity Stepcount Stepcount below which a user is considered inactive Profile percent increase for inactivity Default value: 130
Profile percentage increase when inactivity detected. Inactivity profile percent increase Profile percent increase for inactivity
Additional hours for sleep-in beyond boost start Default value: 2
Additional hours allowed for sleep-in beyond Boost start time, disabling Boost for that period when no activity detected Sleep-in hours Hours beyond Boost start time to allow sleeping in when activity is not detected. Steps in past 60 mins below which considered sleeping Default value: 250
Number of steps below which user is considered to be still sleeping after Boost start time Sleep-in steps Steps below which user is considered sleeping beyond Boost start time.
Steps in last hour above which user is considered active Default value: 420
This is the number of steps in the last 5 mins above which a user is considered active, and a profile percentage decrease will be enacted. Five minute stepcount Five minute stepcount above which a user is considered active
Steps in last 30 mins above which user is considered active Default value: 1200
This is the number of steps in the last 30 mins above which a user is considered active, and a profile percentage decrease will be enacted. 30 min activity stepcount 30 min stepcount above which a user is considered active
Steps in last hour above which user is considered active Default value: 1800
This is the number of steps in the last hour above which a user is considered active, and a profile percentage decrease will be enacted. 60 mins activity stepcount Stepcount above which a user is considered active
"Steps in last hour to be considered activestring> Default value: 1800
Number of steps that indicates user is active and causes profile percentage decrease. One hour step count Stepcount above which user is deemed active.
Profile percent decrease for activity Default value: 80
Profile percentage decrease when activity detected. Activity profile percent decrease Profile percent decrease for activity
